content:
Dear Dataverse users,
We are in the process of upgrading to version 6.7.1.
While testing, I noticed that if I set a field (in this case from the citation block) to hidden, this does not apply. Am I missing a new setting/configuration, or is this a bug?
These are the steps I followed:

  1. Create a new dataverse
  2. Set the fields 'Series' and 'related material' to hidden by unchecking the checkboxes.
  3. Click done.
  4. Click 'save changes'.
  5. Add a dataset. I expected these fields not to be visible when creating a new one, but I still see them.

Best wishes,
Laura
Hmm, I'm not aware of this bug. @Laura Huis in 't Veld can you reproduce this on https://demo.dataverse.org ?

Yes, I just tried. After selecting fields to be hidden and saving the dataverse, you will still see the fields when creating a dataset. If I open the General Info page again, my settings haven't been saved.
Can you please open an issue?

I just created https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/issues/11992.

My colleagues have been busy figuring out where this went wrong, and also created a fix.
(We still need to test it.)
They concluded that in version 6.6, with the changes for 'display on create' on collection level, some code that checks if a field should be included or not was left out.

They also found another omission that had to do with the dataversefieldtypeinputlevel table.
To technical for me to explain, but I guess if we are ready a PR can be done.
@Laura Huis in 't Veld thanks so much for creating the issue! I'm looking forward to looking at the PR!
